kinetic.client

Interface BatchOperation


  • public interface BatchOperation
    Kinetic client batch operation interface.

    Author:
    James Hughes, chiaming

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abort()
      Abort the current batch operation.
      void commit()
      Commit the current batch operation.
      void delete(Entry entry)
      Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry within the batch operation.
      void deleteForced(byte[] key)
      Force delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the parameter within the batch operation.
      void put(Entry entry, byte[] newVersion)
      Put the versioned Entry within the batch operation.
      void putForced(Entry entry)
      Force to put the specified Entry within the batch operation.

    • Method Detail

      • put

        void put(Entry entry,
         byte[] newVersion)
  throws KineticException
        Put the versioned Entry within the batch operation. The command is not committed until the commit() method is invoked and returned successfully.

        If the version in the specified entry does not match the version stored in the persistent store, a KineticException is raised

        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        newVersion - new version for the entry.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        putForced(Entry)

      • putForced

        void putForced(Entry entry)
        throws KineticException
        Force to put the specified Entry within the batch operation. Overwrite the entry in the store if existed. The command is not committed until the commit() method is invoked and returned successfully.
        Parameters:
        entry - the Entry to be put to the persistent store.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal errors occurred.
        See Also:
        put(Entry, byte[])

      • delete

        void delete(Entry entry)
     throws KineticException
        Delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the entry within the batch operation. The command is not committed until the commit() method is invoked and returned successfully.

        The version specified in the entry metadata must match the one stored in the persistent storage. Otherwise, a KineticException is raised.

        Parameters:
        entry - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        deleteForced(byte[])

      • deleteForced

        void deleteForced(byte[] key)
           throws KineticException
        Force delete the entry that is associated with the key specified in the parameter within the batch operation. The command is not committed until the commit() method is invoked and returned successfully.

        The entry version stored in the persistent store is ignored.

        Parameters:
        key - the key in the entry is used to find the associated entry.
        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
        See Also:
        delete(Entry)

      • commit

        void commit()
     throws KineticException
        Commit the current batch operation.

        When this call returned successfully, all the commands performed in the current batch are executed and committed to store successfully.

        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred. The batch may or may not be committed. If committed, all commands are committed. Otherwise, no messages are committed.
        BatchAbortedException - the commit failed. No messages within the batch were committed to the store.

      • abort

        void abort()
    throws KineticException
        Abort the current batch operation.

        When this call returned successfully, all the commands queued in the current batch are aborted. Resources related to the current batch are cleaned up and released.

        Throws:
        KineticException - if any internal error occurred.
